p.s: Sonnet 116 is written by Shakespeare and stands in the sequence about the young man.
The sonnet is about love, which is constant and lasting till the death.
The sonnet has three quatrains, four lines each and a closing couplet.
The rhyme scheme is abab cdcd efef gg and is written in iambic pentameter.
The first quatrain is about the hindrances in a relationship, with love because people change, so love doesn't always mean love (cf. l. 1-4).
The following quatrain says that love is stable and nothing can throw it off balance.
Love is constant and and ever-fixed mark (cf. l. 5-8).
The last quatrain is about the fact that nothing can stop the love, not even the death, love doesn't altersalter, but nacts on till the death (cf. l. 9-12).
The closing couplet says that if his thesis aren'tisn't right, if it's proved that love can be stop, thanthen he has never written and has nobody ever loved (cf. l. 13-14).
